gremlins

Class Gremlin

  • java.lang.Object
    • gremlins.Entity
      • gremlins.Mobile
        • gremlins.Gremlin

  • public class Gremlin
extends Mobile
    Gremlin class: An extension of mobile entity that continuously moves, shoots, and respawns on a given map

      • Fields inherited from class gremlins.Mobile

      • shootSlimeBall

        public java.util.ArrayList<SlimeBall> shootSlimeBall()
        Method that "shoots" a slimeball by creating a new slimeball object, and sending it in a direction (after adding it to the current gremlin's available slimeballs ArrayList attribute)
        Returns:
        a new ArrayList with the new slimeball added in.

      • slimeballMechanics

        public void slimeballMechanics(App app)
        Slimeball mechanics dictates all the behaviour a slimeball should express This is featured in the gremlin class as each gremlin has a set of fireballs, which makes it easier to control and modify then if it were in the slimeball class.
        Parameters:
        app - used to get various attributes such as the map, and other mobile entities

      • gremlinRespawn

        public void gremlinRespawn(App app)
        Respawn method, that allows the gremlin to respawn on the map on an open block at least 10 blocks away from the wizard
        Parameters:
        app - the current App screen with all "valid blocks", current objects, etc. on screen. This allows this method to detect where the gremlin can respawn.

      • gremlinAI

        public int gremlinAI(App app)
        Gremlin AI method dictates all the movement a gremlin object can experience. The gremlin's current travelling direction, collisions, and surroundings are considered. Under the condition that the gremlin collides with something, a random direction is generated that is not in the same direction it just collided with the block in (i.e. no reversals) (with specific exceptions such as a 3 way blockage).
        Parameters:
        app - used as a parameter for simulating collisions in the mobile collision method
        Returns:
        returns an integer n, which corresponds to the direction the gremlin should move in (0 - up, 1 - right, 2 - down ,3 - left)

      • draw

        public int draw(App app)
        Draw method displays the gremlin's sprite onscreen. Under the condition that the freeze potion is active, the gremlin's sprite is changed, but still drawn on screen.
        Specified by:
        draw in class Mobile
        Parameters:
        app - takes in the App class object to use the methods it has extended from PApplet such as app.image()
        Returns:
        the direction the gremlin was last drawn in.

      • tick

        public int tick(App app)
        Tick method updates the gremlin object each game tick. When the freeze isn't active, the tick method repeatedly checks whether the gremlin is coming into contact with a wizard (in which case it kills the wizard) Under the condition that a collision is experienced by the gremlin, the gremlinAI method is called, changing its direction. Additionally, each tick the gremlin checks if it can shoot another slimeball.
        Specified by:
        tick in class Mobile
        Parameters:
        app - used in tandem with the collision algorithm, and to get other attributes like whether the wizard has acquired the freeze potion
        Returns:
        integer 0 corresponds to nothing happened, and a normal tick cycle occurred. 10 means the gremlin killed the wizard.
